entry.title: Tsunoshima Bridge (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that to preserve the surrounding natural environment, Tsunoshima Bridge (pictured) curves to avoid an island?

entry.title: Patricia Grace (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that New Zealand author Patricia Grace did not include a glossary for Māori terms in her book Potiki because she "didn't want the Māori language to be treated as a foreign language in its own country"?

entry.title: Korakou culture (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Greek Korakou culture had two-storey buildings with internal stairs more than 4,000 years ago?

entry.title: Keith Foulger (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that part of Keith Foulger's job was to make sure the front and back ends of Britain's first nuclear submarine fitted together?

entry.title: Agatha All Along (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the WandaVision song "Agatha All Along" was inspired by the theme songs of The Munsters and The Addams Family?

entry.title: his tea-planter grandfather (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that seventy years after the death of his tea-planter grandfather, publisher Neville Armstrong remembered his piercing blue eyes and large white spade beard?

entry.title: DynaMo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the BBC programme DynaMo was created after a survey revealed parents did not want to help children with homework?

entry.title: Norm Michael (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Norm Michael did not know he was an NFL Draft selection until 55 years later?
